intro: Managa guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese managa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, and white. Its leaves are usually heart-shaped and have a rough texture. Managa guianensis is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
